title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 January 2014 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:38 <mflorea> has quit  
01:17 <lucaa> has quit  
02:21 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:23 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
02:53 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:55 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:33 <mrflibble> has quit  
05:57 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
05:59 <Denis> has quit  
07:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <mstaicu> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning  
08:59 <vmassol> I think we have a blocker. I tested quickly yesterday and couldn't create a subwiki (cf email)  
08:59 <vmassol> (a blocker for the RC1 release that is)  
08:59 <tmortagne> yes I saw your email  
08:59 <vmassol> I only tested on 6.0 SNAPSHOT though  
09:00 <vmassol> but it shouldn't be very different  
09:00 <tmortagne> no I don't see how it could be different  
09:05 <vmassol> there's also another problem I didn't mention on the list  
09:05 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <vmassol> (but I pinged GD)  
09:05 <vmassol> the Admin uses screen still didn't show the invitation feature for me on a subwiki  
09:09 <tmortagne> I can reproduce the DW issue, looks like a bug in first step velocity code  
09:09 <tmortagne> mflorea: any idea ?  
09:09 <vmassol> gong to restart ci… seems it dies after a while of inactivity because yesterday night it was working nicely  
09:09 <vmassol> my guess  
09:10 <vmassol> is that we have a tmp clean job that removes jenkins files during the night  
09:10 <mflorea> tmortagne: I don't know what you are referring to. Which DW issue?  
09:11 <tmortagne> look at vmassol's mail on dev list  
09:11 <vmassol> ah ci is back  
09:11 <mflorea> ok, checking  
09:11 <vmassol> too late I killed it  
09:11 <tmortagne> the root is:  
09:11 <tmortagne>         at java.util.ArrayList.addAll(ArrayList.java:472)  
09:11 <tmortagne>         at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)  
09:11 <tmortagne> so some velocity code calling addAll with null (probably a variable not properly set)  
09:17 <mflorea> tmortagne: the only call to addAll is this:  
09:17 <mflorea> #set ($discard = $features.addAll($extension.features))  
09:18 <mflorea> note that this is called only if the $extension is not null  
09:18 <tmortagne> there is no reason for Extension#getFeatures() to return null, are you sure what is not is not the extension itself ?  
09:18 <mflorea> yep, I'm pretty sure  
09:18 <mflorea> let me try to reproduce  
09:19 <mrflibble> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <tmortagne> what is weird is that there hasn't been any change recently in any of the Extensions extended classes AFAIK  
09:20 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <mflorea> downloading the latest snapshot, let's see  
09:30 <tmortagne> mflorea: there is also $logList.addAll($jobStatus.log) in extension.vm  
09:30 <mstaicu> hello, can the doc and odt exports be customized? afaik they run through ooserver  
09:30 <mstaicu> customized as in apply different styles to different elements  
09:31 <mflorea> mstaicu: see officeExport.xsl in oldcore  
09:34 <tmortagne> but $jobStatus.log should not be null either except in some tricky case of a status loaded from fs but there is none here since it's the first time we execute DW for this wiki  
09:38 <mstaicu> mflorea thanks!  
09:42 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <evalica> has quit  
09:54 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <mflorea> tmortagne: should be fixed now, my bad, the $extension was null indeed (I was testing for != null in some other place and I though it applies there too)  
09:57 <tmortagne> yep seen your commit  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> about the migration, I should put something in xwiki-entreprise-data?  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> I'm looking, I remember something about it  
10:03 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: any module that have a migration should be listed in xwiki-entreprise-data  
10:03 <tmortagne> look at xwiki-entreprise-data pom  
10:03 <tmortagne> you will see the others  
10:05 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you did it for xwiki-platform-wiki-user-default and xwiki-platform-wiki-workspaces-migrator for example  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> yep, I see  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> I'm changing that and I commit  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> obviously I forgot to do it after  
10:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok to "Discard Unreadable Data" in http://ci.xwiki.org/administrativeMonitor/OldData/manage ?  
10:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: not yet  
10:09 <tmortagne> might improve a bit the issue we have  
10:09 <vmassol> I was waiting till we confirm that the update is working  
10:09 <vmassol> no  
10:10 <vmassol> I updated jeknins this morning  
10:10 <vmassol> I'd like to be able to rollback  
10:10 <vmassol> in case of a problem  
10:10 <vmassol> I'm worried that we won't be able to do that if we remove old data  
10:10 <vmassol> they're just ignored  
10:10 <vmassol> (AFAIK)  
10:10 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a way how to bind custom action to document update event? (if someone updates these documents, run this code)  
10:11 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: that would be http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Local  
10:12 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, thanks  
10:12 <tmortagne> but you cannot really manipulate this using velocity yet  
10:12 <tmortagne> unless you create a listener that itself execute some page when receiving an event  
10:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: WDYT about removing 5.3.x jobs from jenkins ? we will never release a 5.3.1  
10:15 <vmassol> yes ok  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> I cannot build xwiki-commons on my machine  
10:19 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you sure you are up to date ?  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.1:compile (default-compile) on project xwiki-commons-extension-api: Compilation failure: Compilation failure:  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> [ERROR] /home/gdelhumeau/dev/xwiki/xwiki-commons/xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-extension/xwiki-commons-extension-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/AbstractExtensionRepository.java:[94,12] warning: [deprecation] org.xwiki.extension.repository.ExtensionRepositoryId in org.xwiki.extension.repository has been deprecated  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: yes  
10:20 <tmortagne> I don't think what you pasted is the real issue  
10:21 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: commons builds fine for me  
10:21 <tmortagne> could you paste a more complete log  
10:22 <vmassol> (just built it)  
10:22 <tmortagne> it works well on jenkins anyway  
10:22 <vmassol> on master  
10:22 <gdelhumeau> yes sorry  
10:22 <gdelhumeau> [INFO] Compiling 134 source files to /home/gdelhumeau/dev/xwiki/xwiki-commons/xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-extension/xwiki-commons-extension-api/target/classes  
10:22 <gdelhumeau> An exception has occurred in the compiler (1.6.0\_33). Please file a bug at the Java Developer Connection (http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport)  after checking the Bug Parade for duplicates. Include your program and the following diagnostic in your report.  Thank you.  
10:23 <vmassol> ah  
10:23 <vmassol> I had this exact error gdelhumeau  
10:23 <vmassol> on mac  
10:23 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: move to 1.6\_45  
10:24 <vmassol> seems we've introduced some code that makes some compiler version choke  
10:25 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: from the oravle website or is there a ppa for ubuntu?  
10:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: us of a maven plugin  
10:25 <vmassol> we haven't upgraded the compiler plugin AFAIK  
10:25 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: https://launchpad.net/~webupd8team/+archive/java  
10:25 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: thx  
10:26 <tmortagne> this ppa is always very up to date, using it everywhere  
10:36 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <gdelhumeau> ther pb, why do I have [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-remote-resources-plugin:1.4:process (xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources) on project xwiki-enterprise-ui: Resources archive cannot be found. Could not find artifact org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources:jar:6.0-SNAPSHOT ?  
10:47 <mstaicu> is there a 6.0 artifact for that on maven?  
10:48 <mstaicu> seems there is  
10:48 <mstaicu> http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources/6.0-SNAPSHOT/  
10:48 <mstaicu> I had a similar issue  
10:48 <mstaicu> when building a module  
10:49 <mstaicu> I went to ~/.m2/ and looked up that repo, org/xwiki/platform/ and removed the configuration-resources  
10:49 <mstaicu> and then  
10:49 <mstaicu> re ran the mvn clean install -U  
10:49 <mstaicu> with the -U argument  
11:26 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: enterprise builds fine for me  
11:26 <polx> has quit  
11:27 <gdelhumeau> I have rebuilt localy xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resource and it works  
11:27 <gdelhumeau> mstaicu had the same issue  
11:27 <vmassol> I didn't build it at all btw  
11:27 <vmassol> (platform)  
11:27 <vmassol> did you try with -U?  
11:27 <gdelhumeau> yes, looks like a mvn issue  
11:28 <gdelhumeau> nope  
11:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: still same problem  
11:30 <vmassol> - build enteprrise  
11:30 <vmassol> - start it  
11:30 <vmassol> - create wiki  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> the mirgation one?  
11:31 <vmassol> - click cancel in DW  
11:31 <vmassol> I get the standard admin ui  
11:31 <vmassol> wait  
11:31 <vmassol> :(  
11:31 <vmassol> I got tricked by the menu which shifted  
11:31 <vmassol> and I was clicking on the home menu for the admin  
11:31 <vmassol> :)  
11:31 <vmassol> instead of the wiki menu  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> ah ok  
11:32 <vmassol> I'm so used to the place on screen where to click for admin ui  
11:32 <vmassol> so when the menu shifted  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> yes, I had the same habbit  
11:32 <vmassol> I still clicked at the sameplace  
11:32 <vmassol> sorry about that  
11:32 <vmassol> (that = the false alarm)  
11:33 <vmassol> side note: I still don't like this home menu but that's just me  
11:34 <vmassol> btw the message isn't very ice  
11:34 <vmassol> nice  
11:34 <vmassol> "You may want to import the default XWiki Enterprise wiki"  
11:34 <vmassol> I think what we call wiki is the whole thing  
11:34 <vmassol> not just the pages  
11:36 <vmassol> "You may want to import the default XWiki Enterprise wiki which contains a set of useful pages" —> "You may want to import the default XWiki Enterprise XAR which contain useful pages: user profiles, recent activity, administration pages and many more." maybe  
11:36 <vmassol> "This wiki is distributed as a XAR file, you can download it from" —> "You can download this XAR file from"  
11:50 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yep, groovy is sufficient :) by the way, can i rebuild rendering cache for certain document? (i looked into XWikiDocument, but it has only method setFromCache which could do something like this)  
11:57 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: platform-5.4.x is broken on jenkins  
11:57 <gdelhumeau> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-5.4.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-ircbot-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.ircbot.test.ui/IRCBotTest/testBot/  
11:57 <vmassol> yes seen it, it's a flicker that I need to fix  
12:29 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:44 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: for the admin UI message when the wiki is empty  
12:44 <vmassol> we could use the same message as for the DW  
12:45 <vmassol> going to comment in the jira isse  
12:45 <vmassol> issue  
12:52 <lucaa> has quit  
12:56 <gdelhumeau> BTW the BFD dashboard does not work  
12:56 <ClemensR> when creating a new subwiki wiht 6.0-SNAPSHOT, the DW tells me that there is a conflict in the XWikiAllGroup :)  ... aside of that for me creation works, I just have to keep the old "XWikiAllGroup" which got created because I set up the wiki to have one contributing (global) user in the initial setup  
13:04 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <gdelhumeau> ClemensR: yes  
13:05 <gdelhumeau> to improvite it, we need a special step in the DW to register the users you have selected in the CreateWiki wizard  
13:05 <gdelhumeau> \*improve  
13:07 <ClemensR> yes, me was just a bit blathering along ;)  ... seems the problem from this morning fixed, which prevented to create subwikis  
13:13 <vmassol> mstaicu: not entriely sure about your PR  
13:13 <vmassol> \*entirely  
13:13 <vmassol> you broke backward compat and I'm not sure it's a good idea  
13:14 <mstaicu> I tested the api and it hasn't broken backward compat  
13:14 <vmassol> it has  
13:14 <vmassol> because  
13:14 <vmassol> previously getTags was returning all tags  
13:14 <vmassol> and now it doesn't return translations  
13:15 <vmassol> why do you say it hasn't?  
13:16 <mstaicu> because if you call the methods as they are now, with no true boolean value as an argument, the results that are returned are filtered by the current language  
13:16 <mstaicu> as we agreed  
13:16 <vmassol> no I didn't agree  
13:16 <vmassol> and that's wrong IMO  
13:16 <vmassol> again  
13:16 <vmassol> you broke backward compat  
13:16 <vmassol> one solution to not break anything  
13:16 <vmassol> is to not change the currnet API  
13:16 <vmassol> but to introduce new ones  
13:17 <vmassol> and use those in our UI  
13:17 <vmassol> it seems better to me  
13:18 <mstaicu> (17:31:59) vmassol: mstaicu: yes but in a new method as to not break the existing API  
13:18 <mstaicu> (17:32:52) vmassol: is that from an api pov it's better to list only tags for the current language if nothing is specified and have a allTags boolean to list all tags  
13:18 <mstaicu> (17:33:18) vmassol: this can be done with 2 new apis and a deprecation of the old api  
13:19 <mstaicu> From this: (17:32:52) vmassol: is that from an api pov it's better to list only tags for the current language if nothing is specified and have a allTags boolean to list all tags  
13:19 <mstaicu> I understand that by default we filter by current language  
13:19 <vmassol> what I said is still valid  
13:19 <vmassol> but doesn't corrspond at all to what you implemented  
13:19 <vmassol> :)  
13:20 <vmassol> but you don't even need to do that  
13:20 <vmassol> you just need a new api  
13:20 <vmassol> and call that new api from the ui  
13:20 <mstaicu> well ok, I could do that from the start  
13:20 <vmassol> since this is some old plugin tech it doesn't matter if the api isn't perfect ATM  
13:20 <vmassol> we can make it better when we rewrite it as components  
13:21 <vmassol> but what we shouldn't do  
13:21 <vmassol> is break backward compt  
13:21 <vmassol> compat  
13:21 <vmassol> which you did  
13:21 <mstaicu> I understand  
13:21 <vmassol> users will thank you to not break the api ;) you don't know what they may have been doing with these calls  
13:21 <vmassol> well they won't thank you  
13:24 <ClemensR> duh, seems I broke jenkins with my last commit  
13:24 <vmassol> but they'll hate you if you break it ;)  
13:24 <vmassol> now whether we deprecate the old api or not is another matter, I don't have any strong opinion on that  
13:24 <vmassol> :)  
13:30 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you can force rendering cache refresh by putting ?refresh=1 in the URL  
13:30 <tmortagne> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HRenderingcache  
13:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: do you know if http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-5.4.x/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-ircbot-test-tests/4/testReport/org.xwiki.ircbot.test.ui/IRCBotTest/testBot/ is a flicker ?  
13:40 <tmortagne> restarted a new platform build  
13:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes it's a flicker  
13:41 <vmassol> I didn't change anything on the irc bot side and I've seen it once in the past already  
13:42 <vmassol> I need to look into it  
13:42 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: your commit about user profile is related to http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium-5.4.x/3/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/AdministrationTest/testForgotUsername/ ?  
13:45 <tmortagne> anyone still working or knowing a blocker for 5.4RC1 ?  
13:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: not me  
13:48 <tmortagne> mflorea ? gdelhumeau ?  
13:48 <tmortagne> sburjan ?  
13:50 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yep, i know, but i cannot use this... i need to cache certain pages, because they generate lot of queries, but i need to flush cache if any of these pages are changed/edited/deleted... i know cache is flushed if document revision changes, but content of these pages is displayed by another page (calendar extension), so i need to flush cache for this page  
13:52 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you can't use the URL parameter because you want to do the clean programmatically ?  
13:52 <DarkKnightCZ> yes  
13:53 <sburjan> tmortagne: ok on my side  
13:56 <mflorea> tmortagne: nothing on my side (I'm going to work on the flickering UI test for 5.4 final)  
13:56 <tmortagne> waiting gdelhumeau green light and will start the release then  
13:57 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you can lookup com.xpn.xwiki.internal.cache.rendering.RenderingCache component but there is no remove() method in method, would maybe probably worth an improvement issue  
13:58 <ClemensR> btw: it seems XWIKI-9052 is a duplicate to XWIKI-9826 - even the (unmerged) pull request of the former seems to be equivalent to the actual bugfix for the latter  
14:00 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: something very hackish you could do I guess is access the private cache field in DefaultRenderingCache and do your cleanup from there  
14:01 <tmortagne> waiting for a proper API  
14:01 <tmortagne> the other possibility that does not require going trough private API is to simply modify the page  
14:02 <tmortagne> like just saving a new minor version  
14:02 <tmortagne> that way it will be removed from the cache  
14:02 <tmortagne> probably the cleanest I can thing of  
14:02 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: ok :) i will look into it... by the way, i've re-commited that on-demand extension problem when using rendering cache, https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/257  
14:02 <tmortagne> unless we are talking about doing that all the time with would create too many versions  
14:03 <DarkKnightCZ> well, other possibility is to create counter page (which will count triggered events) and pass that number as param into url (so it will be cached when nothing changes)  
14:04 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: that's cool, you should comment about it on XWIKI-3544  
14:13 <gdelhumeau> back  
14:14 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: ok, done :)  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: the profile thing was commited in master  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: I just have changed the title  
14:17 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: do you think http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium-5.4.x/3/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/AdministrationTest/testForgotUsername/ is a flicker then ?  
14:18 <tmortagne> I restarted a build, waiting for the result  
14:18 <vmassol> msmeria: I'd like to close http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9888#  
14:18 <vmassol> are you ok?  
14:18 <msmeria> vmassol: otp  
14:18 <msmeria> bbl  
14:21 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: I suspect it is  
14:26 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: failed 3 times now, looks less and less like a flicker  
14:26 <gdelhumeau> checking  
14:27 <tmortagne> org.xwiki.test.selenium.DocExtraTest.testDocExtraLoadingFromKeyboardShortcuts is probably a flicker, I think I remember seeing it in the past  
14:28 <mflorea> has quit  
14:30 <tmortagne> it's failing in master too  
14:35 <msmeria> vmassol: check http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9888?focusedCommentId=79438&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-79438  
14:35 <msmeria> I think we need a fix for 5.2.4  
14:35 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: do you know the problem?  
14:36 <gdelhumeau> I am running selenium-test  
14:36 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: since it's fixed on 5.4 I guess someone fixed  
14:36 <vmassol> anyone remembers how it was fixed?  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: about XWIKI-9888?  
14:37 <vmassol> yes  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: xwiki-platform-manager creates wiki descriptor pages with no creator  
14:37 <msmeria> vmassol: did you check WikiManager.WikiUserConfiguration on the subwiki's AS ?  
14:37 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: could you merge your fix to the 5.2 branch then?  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: no  
14:38 <gdelhumeau> in master, we use the new API  
14:38 <vmassol> I don't understand  
14:38 <gdelhumeau> msmeria: WikiManager.WikiUserConfiguration is fixed on 5.4  
14:38 <vmassol> why it's not possible to set the creator in 5.2.x?  
14:38 <gdelhumeau> it is, but with an other commit  
14:38 <vmassol> sure  
14:38 <vmassol> do you agree we need it gdelhumeau?  
14:38 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: ok. thanks  
14:38 <vmassol> (for 5.2.3)  
14:38 <vmassol> 5.2.4  
14:39 <gdelhumeau> well, XWIKI-9916  was a serious issue  
14:39 <vmassol> having all pages created as guest is a big problem IMO  
14:39 <vmassol> I don't really see how we could release a 5.2.4 without a fix TBH

18:29 <gdelhumeau> can we have xwiki syntax in translations?  
18:30 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:32 <cjd> gdelhumeau: it might work but don't rely on it because the translation might be used in some place which is not rendered  
18:32 <gdelhumeau> is it admitted?  
18:33 <cjd> ??  
18:34 <cjd> the reason why it might work is because the $msg.get() happens prior to the wiki rendering but the reason not to rely on it is because $msg.get() can be used in places which don't actually render or render using a different syntax.  
18:34 <cjd> There's also a replacement for that, {{translation}} macro or similar  
18:34 <cjd> but I'm not sure whether it is rendered again after the macro is used  
18:35 <cjd> I suppose if you're in control of the use if the translation then you can make sure to only use it in cases where you have post-rendering available  
18:35 <cjd> in which case it's a question of best practice  
18:36 <cjd> In terms of best practice, I'd say "avoid if possible" but I'd also say "ask Vincent"

23:26 <lucaa> hi guys  
23:26 <lucaa> I have an issue with 5.4-rc1  
23:26 <lucaa> I was hoping you could help me...  
23:26 <lucaa> I set usepath=0 in my xwiki.cfg to have "domain based" farm...  
23:27 <lucaa> and I don't understand exactly what is the algorithm that is used to create the alias of the wikis when they're created...  
23:27 <lucaa> I'm on local  
23:27 <lucaa> and I access my wiki with alias main.localhost.localdomain:8080  
23:28 <lucaa> or, I also tried, with localhost:8080  
23:28 <lucaa> no, no matter what I do, when the new wiki is created, I get <name of the wiki>:8080 as address in my browser  
23:28 <lucaa> whereas in 5.2.1 I was getting <name of the wiki>.<alias of the main wiki>  
23:28 <lucaa> e.g. if I create a wiki called extensionrepo  
23:29 <lucaa> I get extensionrepo:8080 in the browser  
23:29 <lucaa> I would expect  
23:29 <lucaa> extensionrepo.localhost:8080 or extensionrepo.main.localhost.localdomain:8080  
23:29 <lucaa> am I doing something wrong?  
23:29 <lucaa> or this has changed recently?  
23:33 <lucaa> actually, no matter what I do, I cannot manage to get proper links to that wiki... I added an alias in the wiki parameters page, to extensionrepo.localhost.localdomain  
23:33 <lucaa> when I click on the link to that wiki, it's still extensionrepo:8080  
23:33 <vmassol> lucaa: I don't know of any change between 5.2 and 5.4. All I know is what is documented on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/AccessWiki  
23:33 <lucaa> did I forget some configurations? is there some new setting?  
23:35 <lucaa> vmassol: that part is the resolution of a domain name, which works fine, if I write the url manually  
23:35 <lucaa> however, the wiki does not seem to be able to produce the URL of the wiki properly  
23:35 <lucaa> the wiki == xwiki  
23:42 <lucaa> I got it working  
23:42 <lucaa> I had to go manually edit the XWikiServer object that was corresponding to this wiki and put the extensionrepo.localhost.localdomain in the server property  
23:43 <lucaa> it's a pity that it doesn't work anymore how it used to...  
23:44 <lucaa> also, I discovered a bug in the mean time: if you add an alias to the server with the same alias as the server itself (extensionrepo.localhost.localdomain) and then you delete the alias using the "delete" button displayed right under the alias, it actually breaks your XWikiServer document, there will be a velocity error and all
